GapFillInput.Title: Phrasal verbs
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type the correct answer into each gap.

Content.Question:
1. The athlete had to stop running as he felt his old injury flare|flaring up again.
2. How is Edward getting on with his new neighbours?
3. I think Miles would like one of the other directors to take over as chief executive at the end of
the year.
4. Let’s go for a coffee and talk through|over the whole idea of flexible working hours.
5. Joseph put Karl’s incompetence down to the fact that he was over-worked and completely stressed-out.
6. I was counting|relying on Phil’s support last night but he didn’t turn up to my presentation.
7. The mathematician finally made a breakthrough after spending many hours trying to solve the problem.
8. Mrs Bumbleweed went to the hospital to help cheer up her dear old aunt.
9. Stop being so hot-headed! Just relax and chill out!
10. Do you feel awkward if a stranger comes up to you and starts a conversation?
